intro: Schlagintweitiella fumarioides, commonly known as the fumarioid flameplant, is a striking member of the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant red or orange tubular flowers that resemble those of the fumarioid genus, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. Schlagintweitiella fumarioides is known for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its eye-catching floral display.
